home.title: Hey, my name is {{name}}
home.description: I am a passionate Frontend Developer based in Montreal, CA. My specialities are

contact.title: Contact me
contact.text: Please reach out if you have any questions! I'm happy to jump on a video call to brainstorm projects and ideas. Send me an email at {{email}}

footer.description: Eager-to-learn Frontend dedicated Web Developer characterized with a keen eye for design and a passion for creating user-friendly and visually appealing websites.

about.title: About me
about.description: I'm a frontend developer based out of Montreal, CA.  I love building apps that solve real-world problems, and that are delightful to use. My specialities include TypeScript, React JS, CSS, Styled Components and more.
about.paragraphOne: My background is in teaching and marketing. I have a bachelors degree in English from Kings College. When I'm not coding, I take care of my five adorable cats.
about.paragraphTwo: I'm open to  job opportunities where I can contribute, learn and grow. If you have a good opportunity that matches my skills and experience then don't hesitate to contact me.

projects.title: Projects
projects.description: Some of my personal projects, including links to the code and live version. Click the button to learn more about each one.

projectOne.title: Quiz App
projectOne.description: Quizzie is a simple quiz app that lets you select alternatives and then gives you a score. It's built with functional React components.

projectTwo.title: Portfolio
projectTwo.description: This portfolio that you are currently watching comes mainly from an Open Source portfolio coded on HTML, CSS and vanilla JS. I then enhanced in React and added several features such as translation and routings. I aim to make it Open Source and easy to adapt for anyone who'd like a React portfolio.

projectThree.title: Password Generator
projectThree.description: A responsive app that generates random passwords based on a few user inputs, e.g. length, types of characters, etc. Built with HTML, CSS, and vanilla JavaScript.
